plant_categories.description: Plants cultivated primarily for human consumption, including vegetables, fruits, and edible roots.
Grasses grown for their edible grains, such as wheat, rice, barley, and maize.
Plants cultivated for extraction of oils used in cooking, industry, or cosmetics.
Plants whose parts are used to flavor, color, or preserve food, such as pepper, cardamom, and cinnamon.
Plants used to produce drinks, including tea, coffee, and cocoa.
Plants grown for their fibers, used in textiles, ropes, and other materials.
Plants valued for their therapeutic properties and use in traditional and modern medicine.
Plants cultivated for industrial uses, such as producing raw materials for manufacturing.
Plants grown specifically to feed livestock, including grasses and legumes.
Plants cultivated for decorative purposes in gardens and landscapes.
Water-storing plants adapted to arid environments, popular as houseplants and in xeriscaping.
